alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 3:19PM MST until August 14 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 316 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in portions of northern Apache and Navajo counties including near Chinle to the area along and just north of Highway 264. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Keams Canyon, Chinle, Tselani-Cottonwood, Whippoorwill Chapter House, Low Mountain, Forest Lake Chapter House, Blue Gap Chapter House, Salina, Hard Rock, Jadito, Jeddito, Toyei, Canyon De Chelly National Monument, Navajo, Pinon, Navajo Reservation, Polacca and Hopi Reservation. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 360 and 370. State Route 264 between mile markers 393 and 425. Highway 191 between mile markers 430 and 431...and between mile markers 441 and 452. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dinnebito Wash, Coyote Wash, Polacca Wash, Moenkopi Wash, Burnt Corn Wash, Keams Canyon Wash, Steamboat Wash, Shonto Wash, Tah Chee Wash, Hipbone Wash, Balakai Wash, Chinle Wash, Cottonwood Wash, Nazlini Wash, Black Mountain Wash, Oraibi Wash, Jeddito Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
